body_html:
I have tried the following steps to add the C and C++ APIs:

  1. Add all .cc files in the /c and /cc directories to the Makefile.
  2. Add all .pb.cc .pb_text.cc generated by Bazel to the Makefile.
  3. Include the dependencies (gtest, .pb.h and pb_text.h).
  4. Use the Makefile to create libtensoflow-core.a and .so.

The compilation terminates without error and the .a and the .so files are produced. However, when I try to use them to compile programs that use Tensorflow C or C++ APIs, I get undefined reference errors.
body_text:
I have tried the following steps to add the C and C++ APIs:

Add all .cc files in the /c and /cc directories to the Makefile.
Add all .pb.cc .pb_text.cc generated by Bazel to the Makefile.
Include the dependencies (gtest, .pb.h and pb_text.h).
Use the Makefile to create libtensoflow-core.a and .so.

The compilation terminates without error and the .a and the .so files are produced. However, when I try to use them to compile programs that use Tensorflow C or C++ APIs, I get undefined reference errors.
body:
I have tried the following steps to add the C and C++ APIs:
1. Add all .cc files in the /c and /cc directories to the Makefile.
2. Add all .pb.cc .pb_text.cc generated by Bazel to the Makefile.
3. Include the dependencies (gtest, .pb.h and pb_text.h).
4. Use the Makefile to create libtensoflow-core.a and .so.

The compilation terminates without error and the .a and the .so files are produced. However, when I try to use them to compile programs that use Tensorflow C or C++ APIs, I get undefined reference errors.
